author: The PC Elitist

text:
I have to say, though Mirror's Edge wasn't a good game, it was certainly unique and creative. And in this day of constant re-treads and proccesed sludge, it's pretty heartening seeing someone as big as EA actually take a risk.

It's our collective fault, as consumers, that we didn't buy this game enough. If we had, EA might have seen that creativity and risk pay off. Not "FIFA slightly less friction Edition".
Not blaming anyone, just sayin'

text: The game had very glaring flaws, not the least of which was how screwing up broke the flow so painfully (I know, I hate quoting Yhatzee, but the point was very valid).  But damned if the game wasn't unique enough that trying to make a sequel and fix those issues wouldn't be worth it.

text: A pretty long mix of upbeat and electronic ambient music. The only way I can describe this game is that it's an experience, one that I highly recommend going through. Very unique game with an amazing visual style. I wasn't a fan of the few forced fighting sequences but the rest was very good.
